subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Intrapreneurship
description: A fast breakdown of Intrapreneurship for builders.

hook.text: In 2004, a Google engineer spent his '20% time' on a side project. That project became Gmail.

buildup.text: Intrapreneurs are entrepreneurs inside big companies. They innovate with corporate resources behind them.

discovery.text: The lean startup gives intrapreneurs a framework: run small experiments before asking for big budgets.

twist.text: Most corporate innovation fails because it uses waterfall planning. Lean methods cut the failure rate.

climax.text: Amazon's two-pizza teams operate like internal startupsâ€”small, autonomous, and experiment-driven.

punchline.text: You don't need a garage to think like a founder.

quiz.question: What is an intrapreneur?
options: A founder who starts multiple companies simultaneously
An entrepreneur who operates inside a large company, innovating with corporate resources
A consultant who helps startups adopt lean methods
